abstract: Dr Robert N Taub, prominent player in federal corruption case against New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, is leaving his post at Columbia University Mesothelioma Center, which is being disbanded; Taub's cancer center is said to have received $500,000 in grants from Silver in return for steering patients to Silver's law firm Weitz & Luxenberg.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Robert N. Taub, accused of accepting grants from the Assembly speaker in exchange for referrals, will step down from the Columbia University Mesothelioma Center, which is being disbanded.
snippet: Dr. Robert N. Taub, accused of accepting grants from the Assembly speaker in exchange for referrals, will step down from the Columbia University Mesothelioma Center, which is being disbanded.

headline.main: Columbia Doctor, Player in Sheldon Silver Investigation, Is Leaving Post
headline.print_headline: Cancer Doctor in Silver Case Is Leaving Post
